chefBio: While it maybe the norm for women to man the kitchen at home, it has never been easy for them in a restaurant kitchen which is unarguably a male bastion.

recipes.name: Mutton Kosha
recipes.details: A classic French dish of chicken cooked in red wine with bacon, mushrooms, and onions. This hearty stew is perfect for a cozy dinner on a cold evening.
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, and dust with flour.
3. Melt the butter in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
4. Add the bacon to the pan and cook until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.
5. Add the onion, mushrooms, and garlic to the pan and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
6.

recipes.name: Mutton Kosha
recipes.details: A traditional French vegetable stew that's hearty, healthy, and full of flavor. Made with fresh vegetables and aromatic herbs, it's a perfect dish for any time of the year.
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
2. Add eggplant and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned.
3. Add zucchini, bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until vegetables are softened.
4. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, salt, and black pepper.
5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Mutton Kosha
recipes.details: A classic French beef stew made with red wine, bacon, and vegetables. Slow-cooked to perfection for a comforting and hearty meal.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 2-inch pieces
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F.
2. In a large Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove from pan and set aside.
3. Add olive oil to the pan and brown beef on all sides. Remove from pan and set aside.
4. Add onion, garlic, carrots, and celery to the pan and sauté until softened.
5. Add tomato paste and stir to combine.
6. Add red wine and beef broth and bring to a simmer.
7. Return beef and bacon to the pan.
8. Add bay leaves, thyme, salt, and pepper.
9. Cover the pan and transfer to the oven.
10. Cook for 2-3 hours, or until beef is tender.
11. Remove bay leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mutton Kosha
recipes.details: A comforting and rich soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and topped with melted cheese and bread. Perfect for a cozy dinner or lunch.
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Melt butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, salt, and sugar. Cook onions, stirring occasionally, for about 45 minutes, or until caramelized.
2. Add garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until fragrant.
3. Add beef broth, water, red wine, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes.
4. Preheat oven to 350°F.
5. Arrange baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until crispy.
